title: Trail of the Taken
summary: The party discovered evidence of Gundren and Sildar's abduction and followed the goblin trail into dangerous territory. After navigating treacherous streams, dodging snare traps, and surviving multiple goblin ambushes, they reached the mouth of Cragmaw Cave—and leveled up to Level 2.

best_moments.title: Bardcore Rage Against the Machine
best_moments.description: The session opened with the group joking about making a medieval cover of Bulls on Parade as the campaign's theme song.

quotes.speaker: Sean/Belden
quotes.text: We should do Bulls on Parade with old school medieval instruments.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: Oh, dude. That would be awesome. Like Bardcore Rage.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: Rich, get on it. That's your new job.

best_moments.title: Fire and Water Don't Mix
best_moments.description: Kaelia, the Phoenix Sorcerer, refused to cross the stream on her own—leading to Belden carrying her piggyback style.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: You should give me a piggyback ride. I don't want to get wet.

quotes.speaker: Sean/Belden
quotes.text: Would that damage you?

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: No, only when I've cast the mantle of flame that I burn people.

quotes.speaker: Richard/Semaj
quotes.text: Just jump across. There was a person screaming and you're worried about getting wet, woman. Get across the water.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: But it's fire and water.

best_moments.title: Ekran's Graceful Entry
best_moments.description: After Belden crossed the stream with ease, Ekran attempted to follow... and immediately fell in.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: You think this is easy enough, right? And you take the first leap onto one of the rocks and immediately you misjudge the slickness of the first rock as your foot is going to skid sideways and you just pinwheel right into the stream with a large splash.

quotes.speaker: James/Ekran
quotes.text: I turn to the others and I just say, quite refreshing, the water's fine.

best_moments.title: Semaj's Power Move
best_moments.description: While everyone struggled with the stream crossing, Semaj simply teleported across.

quotes.speaker: Richard/Semaj
quotes.text: I've just been standing and watching everyone get across and whatnot, and so I just use my starlight step and just go right across.

quotes.speaker: Sean/Belden
quotes.text: Anything to make everyone forget about the foot thing.

best_moments.title: Belden's Redemption Arc
best_moments.description: Belden, embarrassed by getting his foot stuck in the floorboards last session, rolled a natural 20 on his acrobatics check to leap from a tree.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: You got a double front flip out of the tree and just splashed right— I'm going to say you get an extra five feet of movement from that.

best_moments.title: The Buttshot Kill
best_moments.description: Ekran landed a devastating arrow on a fleeing goblin in a rather... unfortunate location.

quotes.speaker: James/Ekran
quotes.text: So, I imagine he tried jumping in the brush and hit just his butt sticking out. So, as I let loose my arrow, I feel like it'd probably make him jump and then fully fall into the brush.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: Yeah, as the arrow severs his spine. The goblin just falls limp all the way into the brush.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: Did you shoot an arrow in its butthole?

quotes.speaker: Richard/Semaj
quotes.text: I tell Ekran, sounds like he met his end.

quotes.speaker: James/Ekran
quotes.text: My arrow certainly did.

best_moments.title: Kaelia's Mage Hand Distraction
best_moments.description: With Belden down and goblins hidden, Kaelia got creative—using Mage Hand to shake a tree and create a distraction.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: I am going to cast Mage Hand. And I'm gonna put it on a branch of this tree right here. And I'm gonna have the Mage Hand shake the tree really violently so it seems like somebody's in the tree.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: You're trying to shake it, making it seem like there's something in there.

quotes.speaker: Jen/Kaelia
quotes.text: Yeah, to hopefully distract the goblin when it pops out. It's all I got. Sorry, Belden.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: That's really smart.

best_moments.title: Sacred Flame Vengeance
best_moments.description: Semaj held his Sacred Flame action, waiting for a goblin to appear—and incinerated it the moment it popped out.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: This goblin will have to make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. And it is going to fail. Samaj, let the fire reign.

quotes.speaker: Richard/Semaj
quotes.text: 8 damage.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: As the flame-like radiance descends upon this goblin...

quotes.speaker: Richard/Semaj
quotes.text: Basically, I saw him pop up with his shortbow, and I just immediately release the Sacred Flame, but I realized that I did it a second too late, and so I just kind of like scream when I did it.

best_moments.title: The Goblin Boss Falls
best_moments.description: The goblin boss tried to flee, but coordinated attacks from Semaj's Frostbite and Ekran's arrow ended its escape permanently.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: As you see this goblin boss running away. A little frost trails him.

quotes.speaker: James/Ekran
quotes.text: And a 22 is going to hit.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: Ekren, you may not be as graceful jumping across some rocks, but you are landing every shot tonight.

quotes.speaker: James/Ekran
quotes.text: So I sprint out of cover to try to catch him while he's on the run. And as I loose my arrow, it sticks into his chest and I want to say he also falls and rolls into the river.

quotes.speaker: Alex/GM
quotes.text: As the arrow flies, you're going to see it hit directly into this goblin. He tumbles over and both of these goblins are going to start flowing down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily.
